title: Understanding Histrionic Personality Disorder
text: Histrionic personality disorder is characterized by a pattern of behavior that is often dramatic and attention-seeking. It is important to recognize the key traits that define this disorder.

title: Key Characteristics
text: Individuals with histrionic personality disorder often exhibit excessive emotionality and a strong desire for attention. They may feel uncomfortable when they are not the center of attention.

hintAnswer: a pattern of pervasive and excessive emotionality and $$attention-seeking$$ behavior that begins by early adulthood and is present in a variety of contexts
title: Identifying the Correct Pattern
text: Which of the following patterns best describes histrionic personality disorder?
choices: idea that one can influence the outcome of specific events by doing something that has no bearing on the circumstances
a pervasive pattern of disregard for, and violation of, the rights of others that begins in childhood or early adolescence and continues into adulthood
a pervasive pattern of instability of interpersonal relationships, $$self-image$$, and affects, and marked impulsivity that begins by early adulthood and is present in a variety of contexts
a pattern of pervasive and excessive emotionality and $$attention-seeking$$ behavior that begins by early adulthood and is present in a variety of contexts
